Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get the real story behind some of the silver screen's most iconic films and characters.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Vintage clothing store owner Doris Raymond is always on the lookout for the "Holy Grail"; the iconic piece that has been touched by one of the world's greatest designers. During a trip to an expo show in Dallas, she learns of such a garment, found discarded at the bottom of a closet

Clip.Title: L.A. FROCK STARS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The history of 20th-century America is on display at Doris Raymond's vintage clothing boutique, The Way We Wore(R). Decades of high fashion from iconic designers fill the racks of this boutique, each telling a story about society at the time.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get the real story behind some of the silver screen's most iconic films and characters.

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From Canada's easternmost point to Europe's westernmost point, this aerial survey explores the Atlantic coastline, from the wonders of St. John's Newfoundland and the Avalon peninsula - to the unique islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE

Clip.Title: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.Episode: HAITI'S TREASURES: OUT OF THE RUBBLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: It's an incredible story of treasures saved, and hope restored. In the aftermath of the devastating 2010 earthquake in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, a cultural recovery project is born. The Smithsonian Institution, in collaboration with the Haitian government, embark on a mission to restore thousands of damaged artworks gathered from the ruins of public museums, private galleries, and toppled cathedrals.

Clip.Title: THE DAY KENNEDY DIED
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The doctor who tried to save him. The Secret Service agent who was seconds too late. The man wrongly accused of his murder. And the woman who unwittingly sheltered an assassin. The death of JFK has inspired thousands of books and debates over the last 50 years, but the stories of the people there on that day have gone largely untold...until now. Experience November 22, 1963 as it has never been presented before, in this minute-by-minute account of that day, narrated by Academy Award-winner Kevin Spacey, and brought to life through rarely seen footage and rarely heard testimonies.

Clip.Title: KENNEDY'S SUICIDE BOMBER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Rare manuscripts, court documents and key eyewitnesses reveal the chilling and largely untold story of Richard Pavlick, who tried to kill President-Elect Kennedy in December 11th 1960, a month before Kennedy was sworn in as President.

Clip.Title: JACKIE WITHOUT JACK
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Acclaimed director Patrick Jeudy has access to a series of conversations recorded a few months after her husband's assassination in Dallas on November 22, 1963. The young widow was then 34, and she recounts the past like a novel about her dream life with her husband John Kennedy. They are conversations about history, and about her own story - including some very intimate secrets and controversial opinions.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The high-altitude Glaciers that dot this nation are beginning to recede, and the local people are the first to suffer.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Greek Beekeepers and Villagers are ravaged by wildfires, fueled by the arid atmosphere and abetted by the change in climate.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: No time to rest as The Bionic Vet puts all of his surgical and engineering skills into an operation for puppy Jolly, while battling exhaustion.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Australia is famously known as "The Great South Land". And it's indeed her southern seas which most define her. The south coast encompasses 5 States and stretches thousands of miles.

Clip.Title: MISSION CRITICAL: AMPHIBIAN RESCUE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow the race to first find and them rescue the Mountain harlequin frog before the deadly chytrid fungus wipes out the entire species after 200 millions years on Earth.

Clip.Title: AMAZON RIVER CROCS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Cameramen and biologists travel to the heart of Guyana to find and study one of the biggest living reptiles and predators on earth- the black caiman.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: No time to rest as The Bionic Vet puts all of his surgical and engineering skills into an operation for puppy Jolly, while battling exhaustion.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Australia is famously known as "The Great South Land". And it's indeed her southern seas which most define her. The south coast encompasses 5 States and stretches thousands of miles.
